2. a particle p of mass 0.6 kg is released from rest and slides down a line of greatest slope 
of a rough plane. the plane is inclined at 30° to the horizontal. when p has moved 12 m, 
its speed is 4 m s–1. given that friction is the only non-gravitational resistive force acting 
on p, find
 
(a) the work done against friction as the speed of p increases from 0 m s–1 to 4 m s–1,
(4)
 
(b) the coefficient of friction between the particle and the plane.
(4)

4. a car of mass 750 kg is moving up a straight road inclined at an angle θ to the horizontal, 
 
where sin θ = 1
15. the resistance to motion of the car from non-gravitational forces has 
 
constant magnitude r newtons. the power developed by the car’s engine is 15 kw and the 
car is moving at a constant speed of 20 m s–1.
 
(a) show that r = 260.
(4)
 
the power developed by the car’s engine is now increased to 18 kw. the magnitude of the 
resistance to motion from non-gravitational forces remains at 260 n. at the instant when 
the car is moving up the road at 20 m s–1 the car’s acceleration is a m s–2.
 
(b) find the value of a.
(4)

find
 
(a) the magnitude of the impulse of the bat on the ball,
(4)

ball,
